description: From Middle English anniversary, from Medieval Latin anniversāria (diēs), anniversārium, from anniversārius (“yearly”), from annus (“year”) + vertere (“to turn”).

definitionGroups.group: A day that is an exact number of years (to the day) since a given significant event occurred. Often preceded by an ordinal number indicating the number of years.

entries.meaning: (especially) Such a day that commemorates a wedding.
examples: We are celebrating our tenth anniversary today.

entries.meaning: (loosely) A day subsequent in time to a given event by some significant period other than a year (especially as prefixed by the amount of time in question).
examples: The occasion was the six-month anniversary of the Aug. 8 coup that brought General Óscar Humberto Mejía Victores to power.
